channel.title: Home on Village of Consort
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Village of Consort

item.title: Administration Services
item.description: The Administration Services team works out of the Village Office and serves as the central hub for Village operations. We’re your primary contact point for property tax and utility payments, customer service inquiries, and general information about Village services. Our staff also support Council, manage records and finances, and help coordinate community initiatives. Whether you’re paying a bill, asking a question, or looking to connect with your local government, we’re here to help—with a friendly smile and a commitment to excellent service.

item.title: Bylaws, Policies, and Strategic Plans
item.description:
The Village of Consort operates under a framework of bylaws, policies, and strategic plans that guide decision-making, regulate community standards, and provide direction for municipal operations. All documents are available for public review.

Bylaws

Bylaws are local laws passed by Council that regulate various aspects of community life within the Village of Consort. All bylaws must comply with provincial legislation, particularly the Municipal Government Act.

Current Bylaws

item.title: Community Services
item.description:
The Community Services department supports the well-being and vibrancy of Consort by working alongside local organizations to deliver programs and services for residents of all ages. We help coordinate and promote seniors’ programs, youth initiatives, volunteer opportunities, and social support services offered throughout the community. Whether you’re looking to get involved, find support, or connect with others, Community Services is here to help build a caring and inclusive village.

What We Do

Community Services works in partnership with local organizations and agencies to:

item.title: Council Meeting Schedule
item.description:
The Village of Consort Council holds regular meetings to conduct municipal business, make decisions on community matters, and address resident concerns. All meetings are open to the public, and we encourage residents to attend and participate in local democracy.

Regular Meeting Schedule

Regular Council Meetings: [Day of month, e.g., Second Tuesday] of each month
Time: [Time, e.g., 7:00 PM]
Location: Village Office Council Chambers, [Address], Consort, AB

2025 Meeting Dates

  • January [Date], 2025
  • February [Date], 2025
  • March [Date], 2025

  • December [Date], 2025

Note: Meeting dates are subject to change. Please check for notices of cancellations, postponements, or schedule changes below.

item.title: Economic Development
item.description:
Consort Economic Development is focused on supporting local businesses, attracting new investment, and helping Consort grow in a sustainable and community-minded way. We work to create opportunities for entrepreneurs, promote tourism, and strengthen partnerships that benefit the local economy. Whether you’re starting a business, exploring development options, or looking to invest in our region, we’re here to help you succeed in Consort.

Contact Information

Email: ecdev@consort.ca
Phone: [Phone Number]
Office: Village Office, [Address], Consort, AB [Postal Code]
Hours: Weekdays 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM

item.title: Mayor and Council
item.description:
Meet the dedicated individuals who serve as your elected representatives on the Village of Consort Council. Our Mayor and Councillors are committed to making decisions that benefit our community and enhance the quality of life for all residents.

Mayor

[Mayor Name]

Term: [Year] - [Year]
Email: mayor@consort.ca
Phone: [Phone Number]

[Mayor biography paragraph - include background, experience, community involvement, vision for Consort, and key priorities. This section should be 2-3 paragraphs highlighting the Mayor’s connection to the community and leadership philosophy.]

item.title: Meeting Agendas & Minutes
item.description:
Access current and archived Council meeting agendas and minutes for the Village of Consort. All documents are available for public review in accordance with our commitment to transparent and accountable government.

About Agendas and Minutes

Agendas outline the items to be discussed at each Council meeting and are posted at least 24 hours in advance of the meeting.

Minutes provide a record of Council’s discussions and decisions. Minutes are approved at the next regular Council meeting before being posted publicly.

item.title: Municipal Services & Utilities
item.description: The Municipal Services & Utilities department plays a vital role in maintaining the infrastructure and essential services that keep the Village of Consort safe, clean, and connected. Our team manages sidewalks, water and sewer systems, garbage collection, and road maintenance—including snow removal, street sweeping, line painting, and pothole repairs. We’re committed to delivering reliable, responsive service to our residents and take pride in caring for the spaces we all share.

item.title: Protective Services
item.description: The Protective Services department helps keep the Village of Consort safe, prepared, and well-protected. This includes our dedicated Fire Department, which provides emergency response and fire prevention services, as well as our Emergency Management team, which coordinates preparedness planning and response efforts for natural or man-made events. Protective Services also oversees Bylaw Enforcement, working to ensure community standards are upheld with fairness and respect. Together, these services help create a safe and welcoming environment for all residents.

item.title: Recreation Services
item.description: The Recreation Services department brings energy and connection to our community through programs, events, and well-maintained facilities. We manage the Consort SportEx—home to the community hall, ice arena, curling rink, and bowling alley—as well as the Sports Grounds, which feature five ball diamonds, a bunnock facility, and a seasonal concession. Recreation Services is also responsible for both of the Village’s campgrounds: the Consort Municipal Campground and the Open Sky Getaway. Whether you’re looking to stay active, host an event, or enjoy the outdoors, we’re here to help make it happen.
